dol.label: DOL Fundamentals
dol.description: Learn the Design Ontology Language from first principles

items.title: Hello DOL
items.description: Write your first DOL specification and learn core concepts

items.description: Learn about DOL's type system and typed gene declarations

items.title: Functions
items.description: Add behavior with methods and standalone functions

items.title: Control Flow
items.description: Conditionals, loops, and pattern matching

items.title: Collections
items.description: Work with Lists, Maps, and functional operations

items.title: Traits and Constraints
items.description: Define behaviors and enforce invariants

items.title: Error Handling
items.description: Handle errors with Option, Result, and pattern matching

items.title: Modules and Imports
items.description: Organize DOL specs into reusable modules

items.title: What is a Spirit?
items.description: Spirit architecture and sandbox security

items.title: Your First Spirit
items.description: Create, build, and run your first Spirit

items.title: Using Host Functions
items.description: Access time, logging, random, and more

items.title: Persistent Storage
items.description: Store and retrieve data across invocations

items.title: Networking
items.description: HTTP requests and response handling

items.title: Credits and Economics
items.description: Understand the credit system and incentives

items.title: Testing Spirits
items.description: Write tests and mock host functions

items.title: Packaging and Distribution
items.description: Publish Spirits to the Imaginarium

items.title: CLI Overview
items.description: Tour of all VUDO commands and capabilities

items.title: Project Templates
items.description: Create projects with templates

items.title: The DOL REPL
items.description: Interactive development and exploration

items.title: Code Quality Tools
items.description: Checking, formatting, and documentation

items.title: Registry Operations
items.description: Install, search, and publish modules
